body.name: XPG Core Reactor Modular PSU: 80 Plus Gold - ATX - Fully Modular Power Supply - 10 Year Warranty - 750 Watt
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 13. Order within 1 hr 2 mins
Or fastest pickup Tomorrow, February 13. Order within 1 hr 2 mins
features: 80 Plus Gold Certified. High efficiency operation with low noise level.
120MM FDB fan with intelligent fan control.
High-quality Industrial-grade Japanese capacitors for extra reliability
Fully modular cables for a simple and tidy build.
body.description: The XPG CORE REACTOR is a modular, 80 Plus Gold power supply unit equipped with 100% Japanese capacitors. Combined with Line Level Control (LLC) resonant topology, it is power-efficient, reliable and makes creating a tidy build easy.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: SPECIFICATIONS Rating: 80 Plus GOLD ATX Version: ATX Intel 1.42 Input Voltage: 100V-240V Input Current: 10A-5A Fan Size: 12CM Bearing Type: FDB Fan Speed: 2400 MTBF: 100K hours at full load Noise Level @ 20%: 11.2dB(A) Noise Level @ 50%: 850W: 11.3dB(A)/750W: 11.3dB(A)/650W: 11.2dB(A) Noise Level @ 100%: 850W: 24.7dB(A)/750W: 22.7dB(A)/650W: 22.3dB(A) Certification: CB/TUV/cTUVus/CCC/CE/FCC/BSMI/RCM/EAC Cables Connectors: ATX 24Pin: 1 / SATA x12 / Peripheral 4 Pin: 4 Cables Connectors: EPS 4+4 Pin: 850W: 2/750W: 2/650W: 1 , EPS 8 Pin:850W: NA/750W: NA/650W: 1, PCIe 6+2 Pin: 850W: 6/750W: 4/650W: 4

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I can't really say a lot about the performance of the PSU because I don't know how to really test it, but it's very quiet, powers everything I need to, was easy to install and has some nice modular cables.Everything is packaged very nicely, and securely, which is good because it was shipped in the original packaging with no additional cushioning. The bag to store the cables in is nice, but mine ripped so be careful. The unit itself looks nice and feels solid. The cables connect securely and in general it's a very well made and easy to use PSU. The cables seem solid and nicely made, the black covers look nice and they are pretty flexible. The only one that is a bit stiff is the 24 pin one, but it's also very thick so not really surprising. I found them all to be long enough to wire things up easily, but not too long. Overall, I'm very happy. It's well made, it's fully modular, the cables are solid, and the price is very competitive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Works great, S-tier PSU for cheap

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Would buy again (I did x3)
reviews.reviewText: Great product, I have no complaints. I originally bought the 700w version, to run a CPU mining rig. It runs so stable that I put 2 other rigs on the same PSU. This type of use case is similar to product testing. There are a lot of both hard and soft resets, as well as drastic changes in load. I love the fully modular option for this PSU. There are plenty of cables, including sperate CPU and PCI-e cables.I purchased a second 700w not long ago to run more of my miners. I was so pleased with the product I also purchased a 850w for my own personal workstation. Good buy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very quiet, was recommended by Tom's Hardware
reviews.reviewText: This review is for: XPG Core Reactor Modular PSU: 80 Plus Gold - ATX - Fully Modular Power Supply - 10 Year Warranty - 650 Watt.Overall: Quiet. Stable power. Tom's Hardware recommended. Due to the CPU line's length, would probably recommend another power supply if you want/need to route through a backplane. Otherwise won't be an issue.Review:A Tom's Hardware PSU review had this listed as a recommendation, so I bought it. Technically it was my second choice but seems to be good quality.My previous power supply was quite loud with a 30% load, but this one is very quiet.I do wish the CPU power cable was longer though. The non modular cables are also pretty stiff. I ended up having to route the CPU cable over the mother board instead using the backplane.My system hasn't had any stability issues. I mention this because the PSU is one component to not skimp on. Even decent brands can have problems with power dips, consistency on the various rails, or ripple.If I had to go back, I would probably choose another power supply with a longer CPU line. However, if you don't need to route cables on a backplane, it won't be an issue for you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars XPG Core Reactor 750w
reviews.reviewText: Have not had it long enough or have any of those fancy tool-o-matic-measure-thingys to do a proper review, but the pro reviews were very positive and it is powering my PC right now with little to no noise...or fire. It is slightly smaller (depth) than my old "Antec TP750 New" that it replaced. That Antec was still working after ~14 years, even the fan! If this one lasts that long, well, no one will care if I come edit this review to update, and I'll probably be more worried about when they're going to change my diaper anyway.One complaint is that one of the 6+2 split cables was no good. The "+2" split part was way too short and would never reach if plugged into an 8 lead connection (see pic). I didn't need that particular cable, so not too big of a deal.Edit: 8 months and still good. Silent, no coil wine, fan noise, or other random issues.I did see string of "scary" reviews starting in August 2023 after I got mine (June) though. Maybe a "bad batch" or changes in components from the factory occurred? These electronics manufacturers are notorious for releasing a good product, getting good reviews, then switching to cheaper/crappy internal components to save a buck, sometimes completely different to the point it should be given a new model name.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for any mid to high end build.
reviews.reviewText: I am running a ryzen 9 5900x on an aorus b550. I have an rx 7800 xt gpu, and triple fan cpu cooler. Additionally, my case has LED's and 6 external fans. I have experienced no issues with this power supply and would happily recommend it to anyone looking to build a pc.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Upon arriving, I received the package on time in what seemed to be an okay condition. However, I finally got all my other parts for my build, and the power supply was not operational. The unit would not turn or make any noise of any kind. The wires are in good condition, and noise came from the unit, which suggested something was loose inside the PSU. I tried multiple outlets with the same outcome. I will be requesting a replacement and hopefully receive a functioning item. I've YouTubed this power supply unit, and it's nothing but high praise. Giving this manufacturer another chance is a must. It could have been damaged in some way throughout the shipping and handling of the product. Fingers crossed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is the first system I have built and buying a Power Supply has been a Thorn in my side while trying to find one as they all are not alike in rating style and looks. With that said My gut told me to buy this XPG 850 watt Gold Core Reactor because CORE REACTOR just sounds Awesome LOL. I could not have been more happy with this product. It runs so quiet I am not sure it is even on and the way the wires are sleeved makes the system look so clean and neat. It seem to be very high Quality made and the packaging was amazing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ya lleva una semana instalado en mi PC y ha funcionado muy bien.
reviews.reviewText: El diseño me gusta mucho y la calidad es muy buena. Además en su caja venían estampas de la waifu de la marca XPG :0
Veio bem embalado e parece ter uma qualidade muito boa.

reviews.reviewTitle: La mejor fuente de poder en este rango de precio
reviews.reviewText: Esta línea de XPG se encuentra en la categoría A de la renombrada lista en Cultist Network.Cuenta con TODAS las protecciones eléctricas que uno espera en un PSU de alta gama.Estoy altamente impresionado por todo lo que ofrece, los cabes son de muy alta calidad y vienen un un estuche de tela independiente.El tamaño es muy compacto, por lo que cabe en cualquier case, con solo 140mm de profundidad.El ventilador es muy silencioso, honestamente no lo escucho.lo único que poudieras pedirle es el soprote nativo para ATX 3.0, sin embargo existen adaptadores para eso.Esta fuente de poder puede entregar el wattage anunciado(850W en mi caso) en 12V puros, según la ficha técnica.No creo que haya un mejor producto a este precio.No hay falla con esta línea de XPG, verdaderamente sorprendido. 10/10

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing PSU! Better value then the RM850x
reviews.reviewText: This is a very modern CSE based CWT platform. PSU is more quiet then my EVGA G3 850 in my other computer. Design is nice and PSU has some heft to it. Turned on and works as expected. For the price, you're getting solid Japanese capacitors all around. Veyr happy here with a nice 10 year warranty on the side. Best part are the cables. I didnt find them too short or long. Just right for the 4000D airflow case. And you get 4 PCIE cables instead of 2 on the 850x which killed it for me. Nice 16awg cables too for the mains. Wont have any issue filling the Nvidia 12VHPWR adapter connectors without falling short. Dont know why other PSU manufacturers cheap out on cables. So far so good XPG. Tier A (gold) on LTT/Cultist PSU listings.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: One of the best PSUs I've bought
